result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric D. Haakonson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: *Submit DNA sample and pay surcharges.  *Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the agent.  *Any bond/monies paid on file in this case ($450.00) will be applied to fines/costs.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eric D. Haakonson in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court advises defendant on his right to counsel.  Defendant waives his right to counsel for this hearing.  Defendant makes further statement on his request.  Atty Hendee responds. Believes because this was a jail term as a condition of probation, the defendant cannot receive "good-time" credit.  Defendant makes further statement. 
BY THE COURT:  Court recognizes the defendant's history of doing very well with the sentence imposed; however, since the jail time was a condition of probation, Court cannot grant "good-time" credit at this time.  Motion is denied.
to Court from E.D. Haakonson
Hearing on December 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Order - Defendant to reimburse County for payment of attorney fees
Signed by Judge Bult 07-14-16
MARQUETTE COUNTY DNA PROOF OF SUBMISSION

Defendant Eric D. Haakonson in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF27 & 14CF37 tracking together:
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1 in 15CF25.  Counts 1 & 2 in 14CF37 to be dismissed.  Atty Peebles agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 15CF25.  Counts 1 & 2 in 14CF37 to be dismissed. 

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Peebles makes sentencing arguments.  Atty Peebles asks for a report date in December.
Atty Hendee would prefer the stay only be 60 days but will leave it up to the court.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  15CF25, Ct. 1:  Withhold Sentence; 36 months Probation with conditions:
*120 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber
  Report on or before September 2, 2016 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
*Court Costs = $268.00
*DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge
*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

14CF37 to be dismissed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 16, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Final pre-trial at 05-06-2016 08:30 am.
Jury trial at 06-30-2016 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric D. Haakonson in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF25 & 14CF37 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that there has been discussions with counsel.  Atty Peebles states that the parties do not have resolution and asks for trial.

BY THE COURT:  Set for trial
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Return date at 11-04-2015 01:30 pm
Return date at 09-16-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Eric D. Haakonson in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF25 & 14CF37 tracking:

15CF25:
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Peebles; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Peebles agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Peebles states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading. Atty Peebles enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return.
bond continued.
  Return date scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
discovery invoice from D.A.
State's
Preliminary hearing at 07-22-2015 10:15 am

Defendant Eric D. Haakonson in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant states he does not qualify for PD and requests Court appoint counsel.  Court questions defendant.  Defendant states the PD was going to forward the paperwork.  BY THE COURT:  Court will appoint James Peebles to represent him.  Preliminary Hearing to be reset.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing at 06-03-2015 10:30 am
from Atty Hendee asking to reset the Prelim set for May 20th; officer not available.  Ok'd by Judge.
Preliminary hearing at 05-20-2015 10:00 am

with conditions:
*Absolute Sobriety
*Not to be on the premises where alcohol is served or sold

Court will allow the Defendant to post $130 cash now and will be allowed to get out of jail and go home to get the balance of the cash bail and have it back here paid by 4:00pm today.

Defendant Eric D. Haakonson in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that Atty Peebles has represented the defendant on other matters but in talking with Atty Peebles, he will not yet be representing him.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant wants to proceed without an Attorney for the bond hearing.  Atty Hendee requests a $250 cash bond with conditions:
Absolute Sobriety 
Defendant can post the bond.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $250 cash bond with conditions:
*Absolute Sobriety
*Not to be on the premises where alcohol is served or sold

Court will allow the Defendant to post $130 cash now and will be allowed to get out of jail and go home to get the balance of the cash bail and have it back here paid by 4:00pm today.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.
